meanings.definition: Wobbliest: superlative form of wobbly, meaning unsteady or shaky
meanings.sent1: The table was the wobbliest in the room, making it hard to place anything on it.
meanings.sent2: The bridge was the wobbliest structure in the town, causing concern among the residents.
meanings.sent3: The wobbliest chair in the classroom always made students nervous during exams.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was the wobbliest when speaking in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent5: The wobbliest step on the staircase creaked loudly with each footfall.

meanings.definition: Wobbliest: most unsteady or shaky in movement or position
meanings.sent1: The wobbliest tree in the forest swayed dangerously in the strong wind.
meanings.sent2: The toddler took cautious steps on the wobbliest part of the floor.
meanings.sent3: The wobbliest boat in the harbor looked like it might tip over at any moment.
meanings.sent4: His argument was the wobbliest among all the debaters, lacking solid evidence.
meanings.sent5: The wobbliest branch on the tree bent under the weight of the snow, ready to snap.
